quizzes.title: React Native Basics
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge of React Native fundamentals

options: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces
A framework for building native mobile apps using React
questions.explanation: React Native is a framework that allows you to build native mobile applications using React and JavaScript.

questions.questionText: Which command is used to create a new React Native project?
questions.explanation: npx react-native init is the standard command to create a new React Native project.

questions.questionText: What is the basic building block of a React Native UI?
questions.explanation: Components are the basic building blocks of React Native UI. They can be functional or class-based.

questions.questionText: Which component is used to create a scrollable list in React Native?
questions.explanation: FlatList is the recommended component for creating scrollable lists in React Native as it has better performance than ScrollView.

questions.questionText: How do you style components in React Native?
questions.explanation: React Native uses JavaScript objects for styling, either inline or through StyleSheet.create().

quizzes.title: React Native Intermediate
quizzes.description: Intermediate concepts in React Native development

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of React Navigation?
questions.explanation: React Navigation is a library that provides navigation capabilities to React Native apps.

questions.questionText: Which hook is used to manage state in functional components?
questions.explanation: useState is a React Hook that lets you add state to functional components.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of AsyncStorage in React Native?
questions.explanation: AsyncStorage is a simple, asynchronous, persistent, key-value storage system for React Native.

questions.questionText: Which library is commonly used for handling forms in React Native?
questions.explanation: All of these libraries (Redux Form, Formik, React Hook Form) are commonly used for form handling in React Native.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the useEffect hook?
questions.explanation: useEffect is used to handle side effects in functional components, such as data fetching, subscriptions, or DOM manipulations.

quizzes.title: React Native Advanced
quizzes.description: Advanced React Native concepts and best practices

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of React Native's Hermes engine?
options: To improve app performance and reduce memory usage
questions.explanation: Hermes is a JavaScript engine optimized for React Native that improves app performance and reduces memory usage.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of React Native's TurboModules?
options: To improve performance of native modules
questions.explanation: TurboModules is a new architecture for native modules in React Native that improves performance and type safety.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of React Native's Fabric?
questions.explanation: Fabric is React Native's new rendering system that improves UI performance and enables better integration with native platforms.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of React Native's CodePush?
options: To push code changes to users without app store updates
questions.explanation: CodePush allows you to push updates to your React Native app without going through the app store review process.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of React Native's Reanimated 2?
options: To create smooth animations on the UI thread
questions.explanation: Reanimated 2 is a library that enables smooth animations by running them on the UI thread instead of the JavaScript thread.
